data.title: STAGE STAR HARRY DIES AGED 83.
data.meta_description: Free Online Library: STAGE STAR HARRY DIES AGED 83. by "Sunday Mirror (London, England)";  News, opinion and commentary General interest Actors Actresses
data.text:
Byline: VICTORIA McMAHON

IRISH actor Harry Towb has died aged 83, his heartbroken family announced yesterday.

EastEnders star Harry, who was born in Larne, Co Antrim, died peacefully at home in London home on Friday after losing a short battle with cancer.

He grew up in Belfast and worked with different theatrical groups before moving to England to make a name for himself in the 1950s.

He last appeared on our screens in EastEnders as elderly David - money-grapping Janine Butcher's Jewish fiancee in December.

His son Joshua said last night: ''He loved his family very much. But he never liked not to be working.

''He worked all the way through his illness as long as he could, right up until a few months ago.'' He performed in Little Shop of Horrors, Barmitzvah Boy, Death of a Salesman and The Mandate.

With the Royal Shakespeare Company, he helped bring Sherlock Holmes and Travesties to Broadway.

Back in Northern Ireland, he most recently played Tiresias in Antigone at the Waterfront Hall, Belfast.

And in the Abbey Theatre in Dublin his plays included Philadelphia Here I Come, The Rivals and The Importance Of Being Earnest.

His numerous television credits include Z Cars, The Avengers, Home James, Moll Flanders, Heartbeat, Casualty, and The Bill.

He also took roles in the films The 39 Steps, Patton, Digby the Biggest Dog in the World, Carry On at Your Convenience, and The Most Fertile Man In Ireland.

In 1991 he starred with Warren Mitchell in the BBC comedy So You Think You've Got Troubles.

In it he played George Nathan who was trying to re-populate the Jewish community of Belfast.

He is survived by his wife, actress Diana Hoddinott, children Emily, Daniel and Joshua, and three granddaughters.
